question: What is the maximum wind for takeoff and landing?
What is the maximum crosswind for takeoff and landing?
What is the maximum operating altitude with flaps and/or slats extended?
What is the maximum gear extension altitude?
What is the maximum operating airspeed (SL to FL 246)?
What is the maximum operating mach number (above FL 246)?
Icing conditions exist when OAT (on the ground and for takeoff) or TAT (inflight) is _____ and visible moisture exists?
The maximum service ceiling for the aircraft is:
Engine Anti-ice must be on for all ground and flight operations when icing conditions exist or are anticipated, except during climb and cruise when the temperature is ________?
What is the minimum height for use of the autopilot after takeoff in SRS mode?
What is the maximum allowable in-flight difference between captain and first officer PFD altitude displays for RVSM operations?
The cockpit door will automatically unlock during a decompression or if electrical power is lost.
If you lose electrical power to the cockpit door: Cockpit door will automatically unlock To evacuate through the door escape panel:
a: Remove the two quick release pins

question: Which hydraulic system supplies hydraulic pressure to open and close the cargo doors?
If the Yellow electric pump is not available, ground personnel can open or close the cargo doors by:
a: Using a hand pump on the hydraulic maintenance panel

question: Which of the following DOES NOT provide input to the pressurization controllers?
The input provided by the Flight Management and Guidance Computers (FMGCs) enable the pressurization controllers to:
a: Know the planned cruise altitude and plan the cabin climb profile accordingly.

question: The following areas are not pressurized:
a: Radome, landing gear bays, air conditioning compartment and tail.

question: The pressurization controllers use the elevation of your destination airport to plan the descent profile. In normal operations, this information is provided:
a: By the FMS database once you enter the destination airport into the MCDU.

question: The two pneumatic pressurization safety valves:
a: Open automatically when it becomes necessary to relieve excess positive or negative cabin pressure differentials.

question: After landing, the active and standby pressurization controllers:
With the pressurization in manual mode, the outflow valve is now controlled by:
With MODE SEL in MAN, moving the MAN V/S: UP opens the outflow valve and DN closes it. The ditching pushbutton is used to:
a: Close all fuselage openings below the floatation line

question: On landing, cabin altitude will be:
a: Slightly lower than field pressure altitude.

question: In Ground Mode, the outflow valve will:
Pressurization Abort Mode:
a: Is activated if aircraft must return to the departure airport after takeoff.

question: With the GALY & CAB pb in the AUTO position and only one engine generator operating:
a: Automatic Galley Bus shedding occurs for the main galley, in-seat power supply, and in-flight entertainment.

question: A FAULT light in the GALY & CAB pb appears when any generator load is above 100% of its rated output.
All circuit breakers on the overhead panel are associated with systems which are powered:
a: While in the emergency electrical configuration.

question: Activation of the RAT MAN ON pb will cause immediate deployment of the RAT except when no power is on the aircraft.
The electrical system consists of:
When external power is connected to the aircraft, a green AVAIL light indicates:
a: External power is connected with acceptable voltage and frequency.

question: During non-normal conditions, the IDG may be disconnected for its engine and:
The RAT automatically deploys when:
a: Power is not available for AC Bus 1 and AC Bus 2 and airspeed greater than 100 knots.

question: You can deploy the RAT and activate the emergency generator using the MAN ON pb.
The APU generator always takes priority over an engine driven generator and/or external power.
The APU driven generator:
a: Can be used as the sole source of electrical power on the ground.

question: When the APU generator is on and no other AC sources are available, the APU can power the entire electrical system on the ground.
The AVAIL light illuminated on the EXT PWR pb means:
What does the OFF message under the APU GEN on the ELEC page indicate?
a: APU GEN pb has been selected OFF with the APU running.

question: What electric source has priority with the engines off, APU available and the EXT PWR pb switch is ON.
Disconnecting an IDG:
a: Renders the associated electrical generator inoperative

question: To avoid damage to the IDG, what must not be pressed for more than 3 seconds?
The “RAT OUT” memo on the E/WD indicates:
Select the statement which best describes the normal A319 fuel feed after takeoff with the slats retracted.
a: Center tank then wing tank inner cell

question: Which statement is true regarding fuel pressure for the APU?
a: Fuel pressure is normally supplied by the fuel tank pumps pressurizing the fuel manifold.

question: How is fuel transferred from the wing outer cell to the wing inner cell?
a: Transfer valves The fuel system is also used for: IDG Cooling

question: What does the Green ECAM memo CTR TK FEEDG in the memo Section mean?
a: At least one CTR tank pump is delivering fuel to the engines.

question: The white OFF light on the fuel pump pb indicates:
a: The fuel pump pb is selected off.

question: Alternate braking WITH antiskid activates automatically following:
a: Failure of the Green hydraulic system

question: The nose wheel steering is electrically controlled and hydraulically operated by the __________ hydraulic system.
The main gear and doors are electrically controlled and hydraulically operated by the _________ hydraulic system.
Above______knots, provided the ground spoilers are armed, moving the thrust levers to idle signals the flight control system to deploy the ground spoilers.
The two Landing Gear Control Interface Units (LGCIU 1 & LGCIU 2):
a: Swap roles as controlling and back up of gear extension and retraction each time the landing gear is raised.

question: The maximum indicated airspeed for gear extension is ______ knots and for gear retraction is ______ knots.
The landing gear is controlled by ____ Landing Gear Control Interface Units, or LGCIUs.
The LGCIUs send information to various systems about whether the aircraft is on ground or in flight.
Braking and nose wheel steering are controlled by the _________ Unit.
Prior to takeoff, autobrakes can be armed using the ______ pushbutton.
Autobrakes MAX is used only for takeoff.
When MAX is armed, maximum auto braking is immediately applied when the ______________ signal is triggered.
For normal braking:
If both the Green and Yellow hydraulic systems fail, braking is still possible through a________.
Alternate braking is available with accumulator pressure from the ________ hydraulic system.
The chemical generators when activated will provide passengers with approximately how many minutes of oxygen flow?
The cabin oxygen masks can be manually deployed at any time by:
a: Pushing the guarded pb labeled MASK MAN ON.

question: The status of the flight deck oxygen system is found on what system page of the ECAM? Door On the DOOR/OXY page, what is the current pressure of the flight deck oxygen system?
At approximately what cabin altitude will the automatic cabin mask deployment signal be sent?
After maintenance replaces your crew oxygen bottle, you notice the `CKPT OXY` indication is showing 980 psi in green, with an amber half-frame around the numeric value. What does this mean to you?
a: The pressure has dropped below 1000 psi.

question: When the “CKPT OXY” amber message is displayed in the upper right hand corner of the ECAM DOOR page and all other indications appear normal, this informs you that:
a: The CREW SUPPLY pb is selected to OFF on the oxygen panel on the overhead.

question: Illumination of PASSENGER `SYS ON` light on the OXYGEN overhead panel indicates that:
a: A signal has been sent automatically or manually to open the storage doors.
Engine-Ice must be turned ON during all ground and flight operations in icing conditions. The definition of icing is:

question: OAT is less than or equal to 10 degrees C and visible moisture.
Referencing this FMA, which Flight Director(s) is(are) selected on?
Referencing this FMA, which Autopilot(s) are in use?
When either Autopilot is engaged, the Autothrust also automatically engages.
You are hand flying with the Autopilot OFF. If you are not going to follow the Flight Director guidance, you should turn the Flight Directors OFF.
FMGC 1 normally controls the autothrust system, regardless of which autopilot is engaged.
A/THR in white on the FMA indicates that:
During flight, with the autothrust engaged, pulling the thrust levers out of the CLB detent and positioning them at the midway point will?
a: Limit the amount of thrust available, autothrust will remain engaged.

question: During flight, if the thrust levers are positioned to the idle detent, the autothrust is:
The difference between TOGA Lock and Thrust Lock is:
a: TOGA Lock provides maximum thrust and Thrust Lock maintains the current thrust being used.

question: The pilot pushed the speed, heading, and altitude knobs. Which type of guidance are the speed, vertical, and lateral modes now?
What color shows managed speed and managed altitude targets? Magenta Which color indicates an engaged mode of the FMA?
What effect on the autothrust system does setting the thrust levers below the CL detent have?
a: The autothrust active range is now limited to the thrust lever position.

question: Which of these vertical modes will respect any altitude constraints in the FMGS?
What is the preferred method of disengaging the autothrust?
a: Match the TLA’s to current thrust and then press the instinctive disconnect pb on the thrust levers.

question: It is important that pilots fly with both flight directors ON or both flight directors OFF.
An autopilot may be engaged as soon as:
The overwing escape slides are continuously armed and will automatically deploy when the exit is opened.
Escape slide lights, built into the fuselage, will not illuminate automatically upon deployment of any slide.
The ECAM HYD page display shows that:
a: The ENG 2 FIRE pb has been pressed.

question: In the Yellow system, hydraulic fluid is currently prevented from flowing to the engine driven pump. Based on the ECAM, the Yellow hydraulic system is being pressurized via the ELEC Pump.
The Green hydraulic system can be pressurized by:
a: The #1 engine-driven pump or the PTU.

question: The Yellow hydraulic system can be pressurized by:
a: The #2 engine-driven pump, the PTU, an electric pump or a hand pump.

question: The Blue hydraulic system can be pressurized by:
a: An electric pump or a RAT-driven pump.

question: When there is a hydraulic system non-normal, the ______will also alert the pilots.
a: E/WD When the PTU is operating:

question: What does the highlighted switch control?
a: Dome lights above the Captain''s and FO’s seats.

In this EXT LT configuration, the Strobe lights are:

a: Only the smaller taxi light illuminates

question: The nose gear lights remain on when the nose gear retracts.

With the Strobe lights in AUTO:
a: Strobe lights only operate when the aircraft is in flight

The larger light on the nose landing gear is the:

a: Whenever the aircraft is on the ground

a: There is only one halon fire bottle. It can be discharged into either compartment, but not both.

a: Particulate sensing smoke detectors, located in both cargo compartments.

question: The left fuel feed line, through the engine 1 feed line.
Automatic control of the avionics ventilation system is provided by:
a: A single Avionics Equipment Ventilation Computer (AEVC).

question: You can monitor the operation of the avionics ventilation system inlet and extract valves:
To cool avionics ventilation air, the skin heat exchanger:
a: Uses the temperature of the exterior of the aircraft’s fuselage in certain modes of operation.

question: The open configuration of the avionics ventilation system:
a: Uses outside air to ventilate the avionics equipment.

question: Status of the Avionics Ventilation System may be monitored on the:

Unlike the normal operating configurations, the Avionics Smoke Configuration doesn't occur automatically, and the crew must manually set the Avionics Smoke Configuration by:
a: Using the Blower pb and Extract pb.

The A320 cannot be stalled in normal law.
If both sidesticks are moved in the same direction at the same time:
a: The total demand is never more than what can be realized with full deflection on only one sidestick.

question: You are hand-flying the aircraft. According to the indications shown:

Which of these flight control computers will function during emergency electrical configuration?
If either ELAC fails, the other ELAC can provide full control with no loss of system functionality.
Control of the rudder is provided by the:
Which statement below is true concerning the SECs?
a: Three SECs provide direct control of the spoilers. SECs 1 and 2 provide backup control of the elevators and THS.

question: The elevators are:
a: Independently moved by one of two electronically-controlled servos that serve each elevator.

question: In normal flight operations, pitch trim is:
a: Automatic and can be monitored on the F/CTL page and on the trim position scales next to the trim wheels.

question: Rudder trim is:
a: Accomplished by displacing the entire rudder surface and is automatic when the autopilot is engaged.

question: Engaging the autopilot causes both sidesticks to be centered.
The pitch trim wheels do not move when automatic trimming is in progress.
This failure message represents an:
a: ECAM warning which provides crew awareness and requires immediate crew action

question: A Warning is the highest level ECAM alert. It is associated with a Red ECAM failure message, flashing Master Warning lights and:
Which computers are responsible for generating the images that are ultimately displayed on the display units?
What does the magenta dagger represent?
a: An ILS or localizer inbound course has been selected, and this represents the inbound course.

question: An ECAM system advisory:
a: Causes the appropriate systems page to appear automatically on the SD when a system parameter exceeds the normal operational range, but has not exceeded a preset limit.

question: What information does the IR portion of the ADIRU provide?
Each ADIRU is made up of two components. The two components are the following:
a: ADR, which provides pitot/static related information, and the IRU, which provides gyroscopic and accelerometer related information.

question: Which of the following is NOT calculated by the ADR portion of the ADIRUs?

Whenever AC power is established, the upper and lower ECAMs are powered.

To display the CRUISE page on the SD:
a: No action is required. It appears automatically shortly after takeoff, as long as no system malfunctions are present.

question: The PFD should be displayed on which display unit? Outboard display unit. Where is ILS information displayed when the LS pb is used?
The Radar Control Panel is NOT set up correctly for takeoff.
Radar returns displayed at ranges greater than 80 miles should be used for strategic evaluation only.

With the MULTISCAN switch set to AUTO, ground clutter is minimized from the screen.
The intensity of the radar display is controlled by:
a: The outer ring of the ND brightness control knob.

question: With the TILT knob set to 0, the radar beam is pointed:
a: At the horizon as defined by the ADIRS.

question: In order for areas of turbulence to be displayed, the ND range must be set to ______ miles or less.

When the MULTSCAN is in AUTO mode:
